#summary Integrating the output of a morphological analyzer

There are two ways of integrating the output of an analyzer into Marmot.

= Morphological Dictionary =

The first way is to create a morphological dictionary, which is a text file listing a word form an a number of morphological features in each line. Word forms may occur multiple times. A German example could look like this:

<pre>
zweitägige      zweitägige      ADJA    degree=pos|gender=neut|case=nom|number=sg
zweitägige      zweitägige      ADJA    degree=pos|gender=noGend|case=acc|number=pl
zweitägige      zweitägige      ADJA    degree=pos|gender=noGend|case=nom|number=pl
Zweitausendeins Zweitausendeins NN      gender=fem|case=acc|number=sg
Zweitausendeins zweitausendeins NN      gender=fem|case=acc|number=sg
Zweitausendeins Zweitausendeins NN      gender=fem|case=acc|number=sg
</pre>

In the example the dictionary lists the form, lemma, PoS and the morphological features.

If the dictionary file is 'mdict.txt' we can train a model using the following command:

<pre>
$ java -Xmx5G -cp marmot.jar marmot.morph.cmd.Trainer\
   -train-file form-index=1,tag-index=2,train.txt\
   -model-file de.marmot
   -type-dict mdict.txt,2,3
</pre>

Where 2 and 3 are the columns that hold features we want to use.
The form must be in column 0 and all other columns (the lemma in the example) are ignored.
